page.title: 08SHIREBROOK COLLIERY cont'd
page.content: Q. Do you ever practise a full-scale mock mining disaster? A.Yes. Once a year. Q. What is the name of the surrounding rock that the coal is embedded in? A. Generally mudstone. Q. How deep is the pit? A. 700 metres deep. Q. How big is the pit underground? A. It covers an area of approx.24sqkm. Q. How old is the pit? A. 90 years old. Q. How near does one pit go to another? A. They can go to within 40 metres of each other. The planners make sure they do not collide. Q. Are there any earth movements? A. Every time coal is removed from the earth it causes repercussions.
